results.name: akka-uct
results.description: Actor-based concurrency. Interesting for comparing how well thread scheduling works across ARM, x86, and RISC-V kernels.

results.name: fj-kmeans
results.description: Fork/join parallelism with K-Means clustering. Great for stressing the CPU and measuring how well the JVM utilizes all cores on different architectures.

results.name: scala-kmeans
results.description: Single-threaded K-Means in Scala collections. Nice contrast to fj-kmeans for single-core vs multi-core comparison.

results.name: future-genetic
results.description: Genetic algorithm using the Jenetics library and futures. Uses the Jenetics library with futures, exercises the thread pool and GC together nicely.

results.name: mnemonics
results.description: Serial JDK Streams (vs par-mnemonics). Short, deterministic, and the parallel vs serial delta is very revealing across architectures with different core counts/memory bandwidth.

results.name: par-mnemonics
results.description: Parallel JDK Streams (vs mnemonics). Short, deterministic, and the parallel vs serial delta is very revealing across architectures with different core counts/memory bandwidth.

results.name: db-shootout
results.description: In-memory databases (Chronicle Map etc.), exercises memory subsystem heavily. Good for revealing memory bandwidth differences between boards.
